translation.en: [man] There's really nothing...
translation.ko: "나바호 네이션 중심" 친리에는 유흥이랄 게 없어요

translation.en: goin' on in Chinle.
There's no clubs.
No dance, no movie theater...
There's really no outlet
for the kids or the adults.
translation.ko: 어디 가서 놀 곳이 마땅치 않아요

translation.en: We're on the rez.
It's like, uh... alcohol and the, uh...
bad side of life... home environment,
violence, maybe...
havin', uh... alcoholic parents and stuff.
translation.ko: "모 드레이퍼, 친리 팬" 부모가 알코올 중독인 집도 있죠

translation.en: Chinle basketball is kind of, like, uh...
an addiction to some people.
It brings a little bit of happiness for them.
-[boys chanting] Ooh, aah, ooh, aah! -[cheering]
[man] Our student athletes are kind of a... a modern-day warrior.
translation.ko: 우리 운동부 학생들은 현대의 전사라고 할 수 있죠

translation.en: And in our culture,
a warrior is defined as somebody who represents their people...
translation.ko: 전사는 그 민족을 대표하는 사람이에요 "숀 마틴, 운동부 감독"

translation.en: not just a fighter.
[commentator] Fired and locked down.
[laughs] I love it.
[boy] This team actually could make history for Chinle.
translation.ko: 우리 팀은 친리에 역사를 쓸 팀이에요

translation.en: It could win Chinle's first state championship, you know.
We always dream big.
Good job! Good job!
[man] If we could raise a state title banner,
translation.ko: 주 우승 배너를 걸 수 있다면

translation.en: the pride it would bring to our community...
It... It would mean everything.
A state title is a chance for our kids to get noticed
translation.ko: 주 우승은 우리 아이들이 보호구역 밖에서 두각을 나타낼 기회고

translation.en: outside the reservation,
and maybe even give them a shot at a better life.
translation.ko: 더 나은 삶을 향한 발판이 될지도 몰라요

translation.en: [commentator] What a night. What a night at Chinle.
[man] We want them to make history in Chinle.
They have that potential. It's... it's right there for them.
translation.ko: 우승할 잠재력이 있고 우승이 코앞에 있어요

translation.en: And this year, I believe we can finally do it.
translation.ko: 올해 그 역사를 마침내 쓸 거라고 믿어요

translation.en: [Shaun] Chinle is a town of about 4,500 people.
It's right in the heart of the Navajo Nation.
The Nation is over 27,000 square miles,
and it extends into three different states,
Arizona, Utah and New Mexico.
In northeastern Arizona, we don't have a Triple-A farm team.
translation.ko: 애리조나 북동부에는 트리플 A에 2군 팀도 없고

translation.en: We don't have a semi-pro football or baseball team.
We have a high school basketball team.
-Hello. -Hey, Sophie, Shaun here.
-Shaun. Good morning. -Good morning.
Five years ago, when I was first hired as athletic director,
translation.ko: 5년 전에 운동부 감독으로 처음 발령받았을 때

translation.en: our basketball team won four games,
translation.ko: 우리 농구팀은 네 경기밖에 못 이겼고

translation.en: and that's just not gonna cut it around here.
-Okay. Thanks, Sophie. -Bye.
The way I view this whole department,
is I want the best for my kids.
I call all these kids "my kids".
You know, I want the best coach available for my kids.
translation.ko: 제 아이들을 최고의 감독이 가르치길 원해요

translation.en: We decided we wanted Coach Mendoza,
and we were able to land him two years ago.
He's coached for over 40 years.
He's been to eight final fours.
He's been to four state title games,
and he's even won the Arizona state championships.
translation.ko: 애리조나 주 챔피언십에서 우승도 따낸 분으로

translation.en: He's a legend on the rez.
And, oh, yeah, name me one other high school coach in America
translation.ko: 미국 고교 팀 감독 중에 카림 압둘자바를

translation.en: that has had Kareem Abdul-Jabbar as an assistant coach.
translation.ko: 코치로 뒀던 감독은 아마 아무도 없을걸요

translation.en: I'll see you.
[Shaun] He knows the struggles we deal with,
he knows what it takes to take a team like ours
translation.ko: 우리 같은 팀을 맡는 게 어떤 건지 아세요

translation.en: deep into the tournament bracket.
Got to keep the dogs out.
[Coach Mendoza] As a head coach, my whole purpose is to win a state championship.
translation.ko: 감독으로서 제 목표는 오직 주 챔피언십 우승이에요

translation.en: I knew that Chinle's always had talent.
translation.ko: 친리가 재능이 있는 건 진작 알았어요

translation.en: With my background, I always believed
that there's always a first time.
And so, when I first came up here two years back,
translation.ko: 그래서 2년 전에 처음 여기로 왔을 때

translation.en: I said, "Hey, we wanna win a state championship."
Right away, I started telling the kids that, you know, that's our goal.
translation.ko: 선수들에게도 곧장 그게 우리 목표라고 말했죠

translation.en: Saying, "You gotta believe, you gotta believe."
I think with the kids, a lot of it is psychological.
So we've been talking about a lot of things
and trying to build up to this point,
you know, trying to get them to relax
to where they... they're able to... to go and play,
and not worry about other things, distractions...
But, we'll see.
Coach Mendoza, he knows what it takes to change lives,
translation.ko: 멘도사 감독님은 삶을 변화시키는 게 어떤 건지 아세요

translation.en: using basketball as a catalyst with education.
translation.ko: 교육과 더불어 농구를 그 기폭제로 활용해서요

translation.en: There's many student athletes he's coached
translation.ko: 감독님 팀에 있던 많은 운동부 학생이

translation.en: that have received college scholarships,
that are off doing bigger and better things in the world.
translation.ko: 세상에 나가 더 훌륭한 일을 할 기회를 얻은 거죠

translation.en: Before I came here, they had ten coaches in... in eight years.
translation.ko: 제가 오기 전에 8년간 감독 10명이 거쳐 갔대요

translation.en: So, if Chinle will keep me here,
I would love to stay here and coach for...
for a long time.
But that's not a... a given.
Hey, if we... if we play well, everything will fall in place.
translation.ko: 우리가 잘만 하면 나머지는 알아서 해결돼요

translation.en: If we don't play well, then...
we don't get it done.
Okay.
Meal check for tomorrow...
Okay, good.
-Plus car. -Thank you.
The kids will love to know that we've got meals.
translation.ko: 식사비가 있다는 걸 알면 애들이 좋아하겠네요

translation.en: -All right. All right, Coach. -Thank you.
[Raul] Okay, on the baseline.
[Raul] Hustle.
Okay, listen.
Now, tomorrow... first game of the year.
You have to know what you're doing.
The biggest thing you've got to remember,
if we can take care of the ball,
if everybody can do that as a group, we'll be tough to beat.
translation.ko: 한 팀으로서 그것만 잘하면 우린 쉽게 지지 않아

translation.en: [Shaun] Our particular brand here in this area...
we play rezball.
Let's go. No dribble. No dribble. Go.
Just go hard, just go hard. Don't dribble.
Rezball is a unique style of basketball...
and suits our strengths.
[player] Rezball's just like running and gunning,
just pushing the ball, pushing the ball,
getting the open shot, taking the shot, coming back down,
translation.ko: 슛 기회를 열고 슛을 쏴서 득점하는 거예요

translation.en: and doing the same thing over and over.
[Shaun] As Navajo people, were not very big in stature.
So, for us to be effective against some of these bigger teams,
translation.ko: 몸집이 큰 팀을 상대로 우리가 유리하려면

translation.en: we basically have to run them out of the gym.
[Josiah] Rezball to us is, like, really fun.
So we just like to have fun with it and we love to push the ball.
translation.ko: 레즈볼을 뛰면서 공을 모는 게 재밌어요

translation.en: Our coach really doesn't like that kind of basketball,
translation.ko: 감독님은 그런 농구를 별로 안 좋아하셔서

translation.en: and tells us to stay away from it.
[Raul] Hold it, hold it, hold it. Now... Hold it.
You're just running around. Make sure you know where you're supposed to go.
translation.ko: 막 뛰어다니지 말고 어디로 갈지 정확히 봐

translation.en: Do it again, do it again.
[Raul] Rezball.
You know...
I really don't understand it,
but that's... that's why I asked.
There's no... structure.
Not there, not there! We--
We're not being patient.
We're trying to take every... first shot that comes around.
translation.ko: 그냥 공만 잡으면 무조건 쏘려고 하는데 그러면 안 돼

translation.en: We don't want that.
translation.ko: 무조건 쏘려고 하는데 그러면 안 돼

translation.en: Calm down a little bit, you're trying to rush everything.
I love to run, as long as there's a structure.
translation.ko: 저도 뛰는 건 좋아요 체계만 있다면요

translation.en: And I always try to tell the kids, you know,
"You have to make the best decision."
Okay, hold it, hold it. Yeah. Again.
We're just bunching up, guys. That's not what we want.
translation.ko: 그냥 뭉쳐 있는데 그러면 안 된다는 거야

translation.en: Let's do it again. I want to walk through it.
My job is to teach the kids how to play basketball,
translation.ko: 아이들에게 농구하는 법을 가르치는 게 제 일이에요

translation.en: and learn how to play,
and be able to play the game as it should be played.
translation.ko: 제대로 된 경기를 하도록 가르치는 거죠

translation.en: Recognize it. Move the ball.
There it is, right there.
There you go.
[player] Coach has won championships.
So he has the experience to know,
or he knows what to do to get there.
So that's how, we just follow him.
Defensively is probably the... the thing I'm concerned about.
If everybody plays good defense, then we'll...
I-- I guarantee you, it's almost a given that we can do well.
Be patient. That's gonna be the difference.
translation.ko: 침착하게 해 그게 차이를 만들 거야

translation.en: Now, tomorrow, everybody wear slacks,
a dress shirt, a tie...
and hopefully, you shave, okay?
If you... If you look good...
they're gonna say, "Oh, man. These guys mean business."
Okay? Here we go. Break!
[all] One, two, three, Wildcats!
[Raul] You wanna shoot for a few minutes, that's okay.
Get your jerseys over here so we can put them in the wash.
[player] Coach, I don't have to shave, right? Am I good?
translation.ko: 전 면도 안 해도 되죠? 괜찮아요?

translation.en: Get the laundry.
This year is a... a special group of kids.
Because of my background, I'm able to relate them.
translation.ko: 제 배경 덕분에 아이들과 공감할 수 있고

translation.en: I can understand them.
Home wasn't a pleasant situation for me.
I know there's a detergent somewhere, but I don't know where it is.
translation.ko: 세제가 여기 어디 있는데 어딘지 모르겠네요

translation.en: My mom and my dad divorced when I was a year old.
translation.ko: 제가 한 살배기일 때 부모님이 이혼하셨어요

translation.en: So I never saw my dad.
I met him when I was about 13 years old.
He said, "Hi," and I said, "Hi," that was it.
And then he told me that he was an alcoholic,
and, uh... within a year, he passed on.
I became personally responsible for my half-brothers and sisters.
translation.ko: 그 후로 제가 의붓동생들을 책임지게 됐어요

translation.en: At the time, I had to haul water, chop wood...
did everything a man had to do,
because there was no man in the house.
I was the... I was the man.
It was hard, but I had no choice.
For me, it was a matter of survival.
Opening up against Snowflake...
It's always... That's a tough game.
translation.ko: 개막전 첫 상대가 스노플레이크인데 늘 힘겨운 상대예요

translation.en: It's always a tough game.
And just to open up against them is pretty challenging.
Our team...
kind of grew up together.
We always dreamed of winning State.
Uh, this is our year where we could probably make school history,
translation.ko: 올해 우리 팀이 학교에 역사를 만들지도 몰라요

translation.en: 'cause Chinle has never won a state championship before.
translation.ko: 친리는 주 챔피언십에서 우승한 적이 없어서

translation.en: So, that would be nice for us to be the first ones to win State.
translation.ko: 우리가 처음으로 주 우승을 하면 좋을 거예요

translation.en: And it would be a big goal for us, be a big dream.
translation.ko: 그게 우리의 큰 목표이자 큰 꿈이죠

translation.en: And I would love that very much.
Just probably be a good memory to look back on when we get older. You know?
translation.ko: 나중에 나이 들어 회상할 좋은 추억이 될 테잖아요

translation.en: [Josiah] Around here on the reservation,
you can't find a good paying job without a degree anymore.
translation.ko: 학위 없이 좋은 직장에 들어가기 힘들어요

translation.en: The only way for me to get into college right now
is through an athletic scholarship.
It's really stressful, but...
whenever I want to give up,
I just think about my family.
As a son, I...
I love him.
Every day, in and out, we hug each other.
And he's my big baby.
All three of my kids.
Since he was small, he was always active.
He went and did a lot of sports.
I saved all his bibs.
Some of them I put away.
And then, these are all...
all his medals...
here, and... and it is heavy.
Some coaches...
tell him that he's too short,
but then he determines.
He says, "I'll prove you wrong."
And he does.
I'm so proud of my son.
I've always been...
counted out or something just because of my height.
But, you know, that doesn't bother me.
When I'm playing, it feels like I'm just as tall as everyone else.
translation.ko: 경기할 땐 저도 남들만큼 크다고 느끼거든요

translation.en: You know, I think that strength comes from...
my struggles that I went through as a... as a kid.
I have a lot of good memories with my dad.
Kids always think their dads are the best man in the world.
translation.ko: 아이는 자기 아빠가 세상에서 최고라고 생각하잖아요

translation.en: You know, we'd always go to the beach and stuff like that.
One of the funniest things actually was
when we went to Washington DC,
I think we dressed for summer, but it was snowing over there.
translation.ko: 여름옷을 입고 간 거죠 거긴 눈발이 날리는데

translation.en: [laughs] We ended up just buying jackets, because it was so cold.
When we relocated here, it actually took a lot out of us.
translation.ko: 여기로 이사 왔을 때 많은 게 달라졌어요

translation.en: My dad used to actually kind of treat my mom bad sometimes.
translation.ko: 아빠가 때로 엄마를 안 좋게 대하기도 했고

translation.en: I would see him intoxicated a lot.
Dad left us.
And, you know, I didn't want to believe it.
I'm like, "How could he leave us? How could he do this to us?" You know?
translation.ko: '어떻게 우릴 떠나지? 어떻게 그럴 수 있지?' 싶었죠

translation.en: That's when things started going downhill for us.
We had no running water, we had no electricity.
Sometimes, we would have to go to my relatives' to shower.
translation.ko: 친척 집에 가서 씻어야 할 때도 있었어요

translation.en: But, you know, my mom, she worked really hard,
translation.ko: 지금은 엄마가 직장을 얻어서 열심히 일하세요

translation.en: she got a job, and now, she got us running water,
translation.ko: 지금은 엄마가 직장을 얻어서 열심히 일하세요 덕분에 수돗물도 나오고 전기도 들어와요

translation.en: she got us electricity, you know?
She puts food on the table for us.
She does all this for me, and that's why I do what I do,
translation.ko: 절 위해 다 하시니까 저도 제 일을 하는 거죠

translation.en: because I want to get a... get a scholarship to go to college
and, uh, you know, get a good paying job, so I can take care of her
translation.ko: 급여 좋은 직장에 들어가 엄마를 돌봐드리고 싶어요

translation.en: the way she took care of me.
I'm happy...
and my kids motivate me to keep going every day.
translation.ko: 아이들 생각에 하루하루 버틸 수 있고요

translation.en: This is my sister, Tia.
She's gonna be taller than me, 'cause, you know, she had a different dad.
translation.ko: 아빠가 달라서 티아는 저보다 클 거예요

translation.en: I'm going to make sure she becomes a good person
you know, be the best person that she can be.
But, definitely, I'm gonna make sure that she's a better person than me.
translation.ko: 다른 건 몰라도 저보다 나은 사람이 되게 해줄 거예요

translation.en: I want to be like my brother.
He makes me happy.
When Mom's gone, he hugs me...
so I can be safe, and...
-It's okay. -[sniffles]
[crying] So... I want to be just like my brother.
translation.ko: 그래서 우리 오빠 같은 사람이 되고 싶어요

translation.en: Okay. I think she's done talking now.
It doesn't really matter where you come from, or... what kind of struggles you had.
It's just how much you can take and keep moving forward.
translation.ko: 그걸 얼마나 이겨내고 나아갈 수 있는지가 중요하죠

translation.en: Yeah, I shed my tears here and there.
I just keep going, just to always think of my family.
[man] You know what I think...
[Raul] You're a sophomore, you're a senior.
We're ready for our picture.
All right, guys.
[Shaun] Our families can have warriors.
Obviously, our tribe has warriors.
And here, our basketball team
serves as our school and community warriors.
[photographer] One serious. Okay, a serious one.
[Shaun] These young men go out
and represent our people on the basketball court
all over the state of Arizona.
Do your crazy pose.
[Shaun] Some of these kids don't have parental figures around.
translation.ko: 아버지라고 할 만한 사람이 없는 아이들도 있어요

translation.en: [Shaun] The family that they create within themselves on the team,
it's literally a second family that our kids are creating.
That's exciting to me.
You look like Zion now.
We won't get your muscles all in the frame.
[Raul] This team that we have,
they're a young team, but they're very talented.
[photographer] All right, Cooper, we need a basketball move now.
You ready?
[Raul] I always believed that you want your captains
translation.ko: 제 한결같은 믿음은 주장이 기개와 성실함을 갖춰야 한다는 거죠

translation.en: to have character... uh, integrity, you know,
translation.ko: 주장이 기개와 성실함을 갖춰야 한다는 거죠

translation.en: things, like... that make them different from everybody else.
And Cooper is a... I think he's a special young man.
translation.ko: 쿠퍼는 그런 점에서 아주 특별한 선수예요

translation.en: Hey! Watch your ankle. Watch your ankle.
So, I say, "Hey, I want you to be one of the captains. Is that okay with you?"
translation.ko: 쿠퍼한테 팀의 주장이 되어주면 좋겠다고 했더니

translation.en: And he said he'd accept the challenge.
You ready? Three, two, one... Nice.
And for him, as a sophomore,
he's not afraid to take that role and accept it.
And I told him, I said, "You know,
we're gonna go as far as you take us."
[Cooper] For being a captain is that role to lead everyone and be an example.
translation.ko: 주장으로서 팀원을 이끌고 모범이 되는 건

translation.en: It's an honor, you know.
I feel that... a lot of pride from that.
And I use it to, like, push myself, keep that fire in me going,
translation.ko: 주장이니까 저 자신을 더 다그치고 그 열정을 유지해서 팀원들 사기도 올랐으면 해요

translation.en: to light up the fire in everyone.
translation.ko: 그 열정을 유지해서 팀원들 사기도 올랐으면 해요

translation.en: [commentator] Cooper Burbank, with the drive.
And the lay-in is good!
What a move by Cooper Burbank!
There's very few players that have come through
translation.ko: 그런 선수는 흔치 않죠 쿠퍼처럼 천부적인 재능을 타고난 선수는요

translation.en: with natural talents, like Cooper.
[commentator] Beautifully delivered! Wow!
[Mo] He might be our first Division 1 player out of Chinle.
translation.ko: 쿠퍼가 어쩌면 친리 최초로 1부 리그 선수가 될 거예요

translation.en: [commentator] Pull up shot. Burbank trains to three.
[Raul] He's one of those kids that you'll probably see every ten years as a coach,
translation.ko: 쿠퍼 같은 선수는 감독직에 있으면서 10년에 한 명이나

translation.en: or maybe not at all, you know.
And I think that, by the time he's done here,
he's gonna be the GOAT of Chinle.
You know, he has that potential.
[Cooper] Many people tell me stuff.
Good and bad, you know.
I'm always taught to stay humble, you know.
Just, like, be a sponge, you know, and just take it in and get better,
keep getting better.
Aah, here's all the players I look up to.
Each person has something
that I watch or take from them.
I admire Stephen Curry with his shooting.
That's my favorite player, Kevin Durant, right there.
translation.ko: 제가 제일 좋아하는 선수는 케빈 듀랜트예요

translation.en: The thing I like about Kevin Durant is, like...
he is a big man, and...
but he doesn't play like it, you know, he...
plays like a point guard, you know?
He can dribble and can shoot,
things that not even some point guards can do, you know?
translation.ko: 진짜 포인트 가드 중에서도 못 하는 선수가 있는데

translation.en: He's doing it as... at the height of almost seven feet tall.
translation.ko: 듀랜트는 2m가 넘는 키로 그런 걸 하니까요

translation.en: And that's what I would like to do, as well.
As tall as I am, I would like to handle and shoot
translation.ko: 키가 클 만큼 커서도 드리블과 슛을 하고 싶어요

translation.en: just like him.
I'd like one day for someone to have, like...
my name across their back or something,
or even a poster of me.
[woman] Don't you have the roster?
The roster? I have a copy of it on one of the clipboards.
Look for the clipboard.
You organized this.
-Like the blind leading the blind. -[both laugh]
Right here.
Okay. See, I told you it was on a clipboard.
That part, I was right.
Ah, this is an old one.
Well, tell the guys to come and get their jerseys.
-Okay. -That way we'll know
-what jerseys they have. -Okay.
translation.ko: 그러면 몇 번인지 알 거야 그래야겠다

translation.en: [Josiah] Nervous for the season.
People have so much expectation for us.
We don't want to let them down.
We don't wanna give Chinle a bad rep.
translation.ko: 친리가 안 좋은 평판을 받는 것도 원치 않고요

translation.en: It's not gonna fit. [chuckles] So...
Even if I do roll it up a few, I don't think it will fit me.
Look at that. Look at that! [laughs]
[Chance] Our away games are pretty far.
We basically just sleep on our away games,
and getting home late at night at 12:00.
We have to go to school the next day.
It's kind of hard, but it's fun. [laughs]
[commentator] Hi, everyone, from Lobo Gymnasium in Snowflake, Arizona.
Welcome to Northland basketball.
A big one tonight to kick off things,
as two of the top teams in Arizona's 3A conference meet up.
translation.ko: 애리조나주 3A 컨퍼런스의 상위 두 팀이 경기를 펼치죠

translation.en: That'll be us.
The pre-season rankings came out two days ago
and Chinle starts off in the ninth spot.
The Lobos of Snowflake, they're ranked number eight.
And come February,
the top 24 teams in Arizona make the state playoffs.
Raul Mendoza certainly wants to be in that group.
translation.ko: 멘도사 감독은 분명히 그 안에 들길 바랄 겁니다

translation.en: [Cooper] We can be pretty good, you know, we've got everything.
translation.ko: 우린 잘할 수 있어요 다 갖췄거든요

translation.en: We've got the speed, we've got shooting, we've got rebounding.
So, we just need to put it all together
and make... and be one team.
[Raul] Yeah. A couple of things...
Don't take the first shot that's open.
Make sure that we... we take the shot that we can... that we want,
translation.ko: 우리가 원하는 슛을 쏘는 게 중요해

translation.en: not what they give us.
Another thing, don't get in a hurry.
When they press us, we're not gonna get in a hurry,
we're gonna get it across the court and set up and run the offense.
translation.ko: 공을 반대편으로 보내 공격 전술로 기회를 만들어

translation.en: If they're big, like I heard they are,
translation.ko: 내가 들은 대로 상대 선수들이 크다면

translation.en: then it's gonna be hard for them to get up and down the court.
translation.ko: 코트를 왔다 갔다 하다가 지칠 거야

translation.en: We wanna go up and down the court, 'cause that's our strength.
translation.ko: 우린 코트를 활용해야 해 그게 우리 강점이니까

translation.en: Josiah, he'll... he'll... he'll go. He's in shape.
translation.ko: 조사이어는 뛰어다닐 거야 체형이 탁월해서 지치지 않고 최대한 뛸 거다, 알겠지?

translation.en: He's not gonna get tired. He's just gonna run as hard as he can. Okay?
translation.ko: 체형이 탁월해서 지치지 않고 최대한 뛸 거다, 알겠지?

translation.en: You're from the Navajo reservation.
We're here representing Chinle.
[Cooper] Let's go, let's go!
[Raul] A lot of people came from Chinle, and they're here.
-What up, Mo? -Yeah!
[Raul] It's something that motivates you to play hard.
This is a chance for you guys to show what you can do as a team.
translation.ko: 한 팀으로서 너희의 가능성을 보여줄 기회다

translation.en: [commentator] This ought to be a great matchup tonight.
It's a contrast in style.
The Lobos are a big team, the Wildcats a little bit small, a little bit quicker.
translation.ko: 로보스는 키가 크다면 와일드캣츠는 좀 작지만 좀 더 빠릅니다

translation.en: A legend on the rez, Coach Raul Mendoza.
We'll get a first look at his team in action.
Hey, the stands are full with devoted Wildcat fans
and they're looking to start their season
translation.ko: 시즌 첫 경기가 펼쳐지길 기다리는 가운데

translation.en: on the right foot, as they get set to tip it up.
[Raul] Behind you!
Snowflake controls the tip.
And they immediately blow past Josiah Tsosie
for the easy lay-in.
[Raul] Come to the ball!
Josiah Tsosie turns the ball over
and Snowflake takes it up the floor.
Come on. It was a weak pass.
Gotta take the ball the other way.
Hey, let's get a good shot.
Let's go. Get a good shot.
Ball goes into the left corner.
Cooper Burbank for three.
And the shot is good.
And the Wildcats are on the board.
Burbank again on the drive and...
Oh, a wild shot by Cooper.
[Raul] Gotta shoot it, go far up there.
Time out.
We're just making mental mistakes.
You can't take shots like that.
If you don't have a shot, just dribble it out or pull up,
translation.ko: 슛을 못 하겠으면 드리블 하든가 풀업을 해

translation.en: You know, throwing it up is not gonna help us a whole lot.
translation.ko: 무조건 쏘아 올린다고 크게 도움 되지 않아

translation.en: Josiah Tsosie hits Burbank with a very nice feed
and he finishes it off.
Josiah Tsosie in the corner. The three is up.
The three is good.
It was a bumpy start, but Coach Mendoza got his team turned around,
translation.ko: 출발은 불안했으나 멘도사 감독의 지도 덕분에

translation.en: and now they're in a nice groove.
The Wildcats have grabbed an 11-point lead here at the break.
[Raul] Now...
the thing that's killing us right now
is that we're doing things we're not supposed to do.
translation.ko: 지금 가장 문제인 게 하지 말아야 할 걸 한다는 거야

translation.en: We missed lay-ups, we just tried to finger roll.
Don't get greedy and try to force it when it's not there.
translation.ko: 욕심내서 억지로 슛을 쏘려고 하지 마

translation.en: The idea is not how many shots we... we take,
translation.ko: 슛을 얼마나 쏘느냐가 중요한 게 아니라

translation.en: it's how many good shots we take.
That's the difference between an average team, a mediocre team, and a good team.
translation.ko: 그게 일반 팀과 중간 팀 좋은 팀의 차이점이야

translation.en: The team that do the little things, that make the lay-up,
translation.ko: 그런 작은 차이를 만들고 레이업을 쏘고

translation.en: make the free throws, make the good passes...
That's gonna be the difference.
You know, right now, we're up,
-but we've got a whole half to go, guys. -[Cooper] Let's go.
Back to the action here at Snowflake High School
early in the second half. It's been all Wildcats.
Cooper Burbank, the crossover... pull up...
The shot is good.
-Wildcats' lead has grown to 18. -[whistle blows]
We're up! We can go further, but we've gotta be smart.
translation.ko: 점수를 더 낼 수 있지만 똑똑하게 경기해야 해

translation.en: Hey, don't beat ourselves. Let's go.
[commentator] Josiah Tsosie trapped, his pass, right to the Lobos,
translation.ko: 트랩에 빠진 조사이어 소시 패스한 공은 로보스가 가로채

translation.en: they'll take it the other way
and there's the lay-in.
Be patient.
Josiah Tsosie drives, forces up the shot, gets off the mark.
translation.ko: 조사이어 소시의 돌파 힘겹게 슛, 림을 스칩니다

translation.en: [Raul] Josiah!
And Snowflake has got the ball again.
[Raul] Shoot us out of the game.
Go get him.
He just wants to shoot the ball.
Josiah!
Coach Mendoza has decided to give his point guard a rest.
He heads to the bench with eight points... but five turnovers.
Come on. You gotta get your head in the game.
Snowflake jump shot, eight.
Snowflake might have a pulse here.
They score a couple of quick buckets, give their fans some hope.
translation.ko: 빠른 점수 추가로 팬에게 희망을 주는군요

translation.en: [Raul] We can't let 'em get back in the game.
We have to be disciplined.
Play better defense. Okay?
Lobos on the drive, the dish,
Cooper steals the pass.
It's knocked away...
and it might have gone off Cooper's legs.
And it's Snowflake's basketball.
-Cooper! -[whistle blows]
-He's just not there. -Yeah.
Stay in the game!
Don't... Don't space out!
-Hey, focus on what you're doing. -[buzzer sounds]
[commentator] The Wildcats' lead is dwindling.
The Lobos are not gonna go away quietly.
They keep hanging around out there.
[Raul] Listen, keep playing!
Don't give up!
You gotta want it more than they do!
[commentator] And the game is tied, 69-69.
Unbelievable.
The Snowflake Lobos have battled
all the way back from 18 down to knotted up.
The Wildcats need somebody, anybody to step up on offense.
-[Raul] Time out. -[whistle blows]
Now, listen. This is what we're doing.
Cooper, you're right here.
You're gonna act ike you're gonna set the pick,
and just go, okay?
And then Josiah, you're here.
Okay? One of you guys are gonna get it.
So, with the game on the line,
it looks like Josiah Tsosie is coming back in.
[all] One, two, three, WIldcats!
Snowflake with pressure defense,
Chance Harvey brings it up the left side and up from there.
Back to the top, Josiah Tsosie has it.
And a pass nearly stolen by the Lobos.
But Burbank picks it up, saves it for the Wildcats.
Sixty-nine, sixty-nine.
Dewayne Tom on the right angle. Nothing there for him.
translation.ko: 드웨인 톰이 오른쪽에서 마땅한 곳이 없군요

translation.en: Passes it up, swing it around left side.
Seconds to play.
Cooper Burbank from the corner,
a three up and good!
The Wildcats have made the shot,
and Chinle is gonna come away
with a victory at Snowflake, 72 to 69,
translation.ko: 승리를 거머쥐고 갑니다 최종 스코어 72 대 69

translation.en: to begin their brand-new season.
[Raul] Okay, we've gotta look at this tonight as something to learn from.
translation.ko: 주목, 오늘 경기에서 배울 점을 찾아야 한다

translation.en: Good to win, but again, look at how we played.
All those mental mistakes...
We can't have it.
We could have beat them by 15 or more, easily.
translation.ko: 15점 차 이상으로 거뜬히 이길 수 있었어

translation.en: But we seem like we...
When we got ahead, some of you guys relaxed. You can't do that.
translation.ko: 선두가 되자 느슨해졌는데 그러면 안 돼

translation.en: You gotta keep playing through the whole thing.
Otherwise, you know, it was a win...
but this is something you... In order to beat a tough team,
you've gotta be mentally tough too.
I thought mentally, we lost in the second half.
We weren't there mentally, and that was the biggest thing.
That's just something you've gotta learn.
Look at yourself in the mirror and say,
"What did I do that I need to correct?"
All of us can go down and say, "What did I do that I need to correct?"
translation.ko: 모두 집에 가서 물어봐 '내가 고칠 점이 뭔가?'

translation.en: And that's how you become better as individuals.
translation.ko: 그렇게 한 선수로서 더 나아지는 거고

translation.en: And as a team, we're gonna get better as we go.
translation.ko: 한 팀으로서 경기하면서 더 나아질 거야

translation.en: Okay?
Break. Go.
-[Cooper] Wildcats on three. -One, two, three. Wildcats!
translation.ko: - 셋에 구호 - 하나, 둘, 셋, 와일드캣츠

translation.en: Put your jerseys in one area so we can pick them up.
translation.ko: 저지 벗어서 한 곳에 놔 가져갈 수 있게

translation.en: [Raul] As a head coach, I've seen kids that are very... talented,
translation.ko: 감독으로 있으면서 출중한 아이들을 많이 봤어요

translation.en: very good players,
but didn't even get a chance to go to state playoffs.
translation.ko: 주 플레이오프에 나갈 기회를 얻지 못했죠

translation.en: [player] My man, 27 points, Coop!
[player 2] Damn, Coop.
[Raul] Good shot, Coop.
I always try to get the kids to understand
translation.ko: 주 플레이오프에 나가는 건 특별한 거라고

translation.en: that getting into the playoffs is a special thing.
A lot of it is the mental thing.
Everything has to fall in place to win the state championship.
translation.ko: 주 챔피언십을 따내려면 모든 게 들어맞아야 해요

translation.en: You know, this team that we have, we have a group of seniors.
translation.ko: 올해 우리 팀에는 졸업반 선수들이 있고

translation.en: We're gonna lose 'em next year.
You know, our guys have to learn to realize the urgency, I guess you could say.
translation.ko: 선수들이 그 시급함을 알아야 한다고 생각해요

translation.en: We have the capability of winning the whole thing.
translation.ko: 우린 주 우승까지 거머쥘 능력이 있는데

translation.en: Why not go for it now?
translation.ko: 지금 도전 안 할 이유가 없죠

translation.en: It's your time to accomplish the impossible,
translation.ko: 지금이 그 불가능을 가능하게 할 때예요

translation.en: which is something that we've never done here in Chinle,
translation.ko: 친리에서 한 번도 해내지 못한 일이죠

translation.en: win a state championship.
So I'm hoping that the kids are starting to begin to understand
that this... this is it. This is the time to do it.
translation.ko: 지금이 그 때고 지금이 우승할 때라고요

translation.en: This is the year.
